### 📌 Disease:
📌  Durian Allocaridara Attack (Wilting Durian Disease)

### 💥 Cause:
- 💥  Caused by the fungus Allocarbon durianicola, which attacks the leaves of durian trees, causing them to yellow and wilt.


### 😷 Symptoms:
- 😷  Yellowing, wilting, and eventual death of leaves, often starting from the oldest leaves and working their way towards the newer leaves. A white or greyish-brown fungal growth may be observed on affected leaves.


### 💊 Treatment & Prevention:
- 💊  Apply fungicides such as Thiabendazole or copper oxychloride to control the spread of the disease. Practicing good sanitation, pruning wounded parts, and avoiding overwatering can help prevent the disease. Encourage good air circulation and sunlight exposure to help durians become more resistant.
